trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Opportunist Shieldwall
entries: If a target violates the mark of a Sahuagin phalanx, they take 1 piercing damage for every centurion within 10 feet.

action.name: Aquatic Phalanx (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} + X, reach 10 ft., one target: {@h} 1 * X piercing damage. Target is marked by the Sahuagin Phalanx. While marked this way, the target takes a -X penalty to saves against nets.

action.name: Great Catch (Group Action)
entries: Target a single creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 10}+x Dexterity Saving Throw or become {@condition restrained} by your net. The creature can attempt an escape using an action or by dealing 5 or more slashing or fire.

Across fog-shrouded coasts or endless ocean swells, an ominous drone sounded on a conch shell chills the blood of all who hear it. This is the sound of the sahuagin hunting horn-a call to raid and battle. Coastal settlers refer to sahuagin as "sea devils," for sahuagin have no compassion in them, slaughtering the crews of ships and decimating coastal villages.

entries.name: Devils of the Deep
entries: Sahuagin are a predatory, piscine race that ventures from the ocean's black depths to hunt the creatures of the shallows and shore. Though they dwell in the deepest trenches of the ocean, sahuagin view the entire aquatic realm as their kingdom and the creatures in it as blood sport for their hunting parties.
The self-styled rulers of sahuagin ocean domains are massive mutant males that grow second sets of arms. They are terrible foes in battle, and all sahuagin bow down before these powerful barons.

entries.name: Way of the Shark
entries: Sahuagin worship the shark god Sekolah. Only female sahuagin are deemed worthy of channeling the god's power, and priestesses hold tremendous sway in sahuagin communities.

Sahuagin are driven into a frenzy by the smell of fresh blood. As worshipers of Sekolah, they also have a special kinship with sharks, which they train as attack animals. Even untrained sharks recognize sahuagin as allies and don't prey on them.

entries.name: Elven Enmity
entries: The sahuagin might control the oceans if not for the presence of their mortal enemies, the aquatic elves. Wars between the two races have raged for centuries across the coasts and seas of the world, disrupting maritime trade and drawing other races into the bloody conflict.

So intense is sahuagin hatred for the aquatic elves that the sea devils have adapted to combat their ancient foes. A sahuagin born near enough to an aquatic elf community can enter the world as a malenti-a sahuagin that physically resembles an aquatic elf in every way. Sahuagin are prone to mutation, but whether this rare phenomenon is a result of the wars between the sahuagin and the aquatic elves-or whether it preceded or even began the conflict-none can say.

The sahuagin put the malenti to good use as spies and assassins in aquatic elf cities and the societies of other creatures that pose a threat to sahuagin. The mere shadow of the malenti threat incites paranoia and suspicion among aquatic elves, whose resilience is weakened as the prelude to an actual sahuagin invasion.
TThe village was empty, the seagulls were strangely quiet, and all we could hear was the surge of the sea.
entries.by: An account of the aftermath of a sahuagin raid

action.name: Signature Attack (Tongue Lash)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6+4} acid damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Distracting Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The worm makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals its normal effects, and the next attack roll made against the target before the start of the worm's next turn has advantage.

action.name: 3rd Level: Tongue Grab (5 Ferocity)
entries: The worm makes a signature attack. On a hit, the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the worm can't make a signature attack against another target.

action.name: 5th Level: Swallow (8 Ferocity)
entries: The worm attempts to swallow a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of them. The target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and is swallowed. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't swallowed. The worm can have only one target swallowed at a time.

A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, they have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and they take {@damage 4d6} acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns. Whenever the worm takes damage, they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or regurgitate the swallowed creature, who falls {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the worm. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 or half the triggering damage, whichever is higher. If the worm is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the worm and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Item Storage
entries: The worm can swallow an object without harming it by storing the object in a second stomach. They can use this bonus action again to regurgitate a specific stored object without disturbing any other objects in their second stomach. A regurgitated object lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the worm.
The worm's second stomach can hold up to 40 pounds of objects, not exceeding a volume of 10 cubic feet.

reaction.name: Psionic Link
entries: Xol has a psionic heat capacity of 4. When his caregiver must make an Intelligence Saving throw, he can use his reaction to give them a bonus of +1 to +4, taking the same amount of psionic heat. If Xol goes over his heat capacity, his ferocity increases by 10, as well as undergoing a standard Psychic Crisis.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace|TOMK}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.by: An account of the aftermath of a sahuagin raid

trait.name: Sunbeetle Armor
entries: The knight's armor is perpetually slick. Any attempts to grapple the knight have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against magic and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The queensguard makes four attacks with its g'irakas, or makes three attacks and uses its immobilizing spittle once.

action.name: G'iraka
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Immobilizing Spittle
entries: The queensguard sprays thick, resinous spittle onto a creature within 30 feet. The target must make a {@dc 14} strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} (save at end of turn ends).

reaction.name: Interception
entries: When a melee attack targeting an ally within 5 feet hits them and does damage, reduce that damage by {@damage 1d10 + 3}

spellcasting.name: Psionic Drizzle
headerEntries: The queensguard is weakly psionic ({@dc 12}). It has a heat capacity of 3 and access to the following emanations:

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the thri-kreen takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the pile takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 + Group Size piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 10}  + Group Size Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned}. REOTE. Requires a group of size 2 or more.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 slashing damage.
Thri-kreen wander the deserts and savannas of the world, avoiding all other races.

entries.name: Thri-Kreen Communication
entries: Thri-kreen employ a language without words. To show emotion and reaction, a thri-kreen clacks its mandibles and waves its antennae, giving other thri-kreen a sense of what it is thinking and feeling. Other creatures find this manner of communication difficult to interpret and impossible to duplicate.

When forced to interact with creatures of other intelligent species, thri-kreen employ alternative methods of communication, such as drawing pictures in sand or making pictures out of twigs or blades of grass.

entries.name: Limited Emotions
entries: Thri-kreen experience the full range of emotions but aren't as prone to emotional outbursts as humans. Thri-kreen with psionic ability often demonstrate a wider range of emotions, particularly if they live near or interact with humans or other highly emotional creatures.

entries.name: Isolationists and Wanderers
entries: Thri-kreen consider all other living creatures as potential nourishment, and they love the taste of elf flesh in particular. If a creature might be useful for something other than food, the thri-kreen aren't likely to attack it on sight. Thri-kreen kill to survive, never for sport.

entries.name: Sleepless
entries: Thri-kreen don't require sleep and can rest while remaining alert and performing light tasks. Their inability to sleep is thought to be the reason why thri-kreen have such short lifespans, the average thri-kreen life expectancy being only thirty years.

monster.name: USTAR, BLOOD DRIPPING FROM THE FANGS OF HEAVEN EXTINGUISHES ONLY THE WEAK FLAME
languages: the languages they knew in life

trait.name: Flammable
entries: Whenever the mummy takes fire damage, they take an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Mummy Dust
entries: Whenever the mummy takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of them takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Deadlord of Anauroch
entries: If this creature is reduced to 0 hit points while its canopic jar remains intact, it reforms one round later at half of its maximum hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy makes three Desiccating Slam attacks and uses Guardian Curse.

action.name: Desiccating Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Until the start of the mummy's next turn, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet and the target can't regain hit points.

action.name: Guardian Curse
entries: The mummy calls down a scourge on one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. While cursed in this way, whenever the target takes damage, they take an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage that can't be reduced in any way. The curse lasts until removed by a {@i cure ailment} power, a {@spell remove curse} spell, or a similar supernatural effect. A target who succeeds on their saving throw is immune to the Guardian Curse of all mummies for the next 24 hours.

legendaryHeader: Ustar has three Villain Actions. He can use only one per round and must use them in order.

legendary.name: 1. Terror in the Night
entries: Ustar lets out an otherworldly howl, and all living creatures must make a {@dc 16} wisdom save against fear. SEOTE.
Then, Ustar can move his full movement towards a creature who failed this save.

legendary.name: 2. Devour Worlds
entries: Ustar picks up a mummy rotwrap (or scoops up their viscera if none are left alive), healing himself {@dice 3d10 + 5} hit points and gaining a bless effect for the next 10 minutes.

legendary.name: 3. FEAST OF YENOGHU
entries: Every creature cut by Ustar's claws makes a {@dc 17} CON save against delayed poison. SEOTE. Ustar cackles and pounces on one {@condition poisoned} target

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Kobolds are craven reptilian humanoids that worship evil dragons as demigods and serve them as minions and toadies. Kobolds inhabit dragons' lairs when they can but more commonly infest dungeons, gathering treasures and trinkets to add to their own tiny hoards.

entries.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: Kobolds are egg-laying creatures. They mature quickly and can live to be "great wyrms" more than a century old. However, many kobolds perish before they reach the end of their first decade. Physically weak, they are easy prey for predators. This vulnerability forces them to band together. Their superior numbers can win battles against powerful adversaries, but often with massive casualties on the kobold side.

entries.name: Tunnelers and Builders
entries: Kobolds make up for their physical ineptitude with a cleverness for trap making and tunneling. Their lairs consist of low tunnels through which they move easily but which hinder larger humanoids. Kobolds also riddle their lairs with traps. The most insidious kobold traps make use of natural hazards and other creatures. A trip wire might connect to a spring-loaded trap that hurls clay pots of flesh-eating green slime or flings crates of venomous giant centipedes at intruders.

entries.name: The Lost God
entries: In addition to the dragons they revere, kobolds worship a lesser god named Kurtulmak. Legends speak of how Kurtulmak served as Tiamat's vassal in the Nine Hells until Garl Glittergold, the god of gnomes, stole a trinket from the Dragon Queen's hoard. Tiamat sent Kurtulmak to retrieve the trinket, but Garl Glittergold played a trick on him, collapsing the earth and trapping the kobold god in an underground maze for eternity. For this reason, kobolds hate gnomes and pranks of any kind. Kurtulmak's most devoted worshipers dedicate themselves to finding and releasing their lost god from his prison-maze.

bonus.name: Sand Armor
entries: When walking on sand, the Kobold can roll around in the sand, coating their scales and providing a +1 to their AC for 1 minute.

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thri-kreen makes two attacks with its Gythka.

action.name: Gythka
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.
Thri-kreen wander the deserts and savannas of the world, avoiding all other races.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Rain
headerEntries: The chakak is powerful psionic. It has 5 heat capacity, with a psionic DC of 12. It has imprints of the following emanations.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace|TOMK}.

trait.name: Badberry
entries: Any non-minion ally within 30 feet of a hunter can use its bonus action to consume a Badberry, healing them for {@dice 1d4} hit points if they are plague-cursed.

trait.name: Minion
entries: When this creature takes damage from an attack or failed save, it dies. If it takes damage from any other source, it is reduced to 0 hit points if the damage it takes is higher than its max hit points.

action.name: Volley (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 5} + X to hit, range 120/240 ft., one creature. {@h}4 * X piercing damage. If this attack was made by more than one hunter, the target is pinned down on a hit, reducing their movement speed by half until the end of these minions' next turn.

action.name: Dirty Tactics (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} + X to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 * X slashing damage, and the target can't make opportunity attacks until the start of their next turn. If this attack is made with flanking, knock the target {@condition prone}

bonus.name: Hunter's Mark (Group Action)
entries: Mark a target for death. Only one target can be marked at a time. When hunters make a group attack against a marked target, increase their bonus to hit and damage by 1 for every 2 hunters in the attack.

monster.name: Mariya Liadon, Zhentarim Gloomstalker

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mariya casts using her wisdom via a Ruby of the War Mage embedded in her longbow. Her spell attack bonus is 6, and her spell save DC is 14. She has the following spell slots.

trait.name: Gloomstalker
entries: Mariya adds her wisdom modifier to her initiative roll. If she is within darkness, she is {@condition invisible} to all creatures, even those with darkvision. Due to her half-elf heritage, Mariya can become Heavily Obscured by hiding within light foliage or brush.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mariya makes two attacks with either her Longbow or her Elven Longsword. If with her Longbow, she can immediately take the Hide action as a part of this action.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Elven Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

bonus.name: Mark for Death
entries: Mariya targets a single creature with her enmity. That creature becomes Marked For Death, taking 1 piercing damage every time it takes damage from any other source. This effect ends when Mariya goes {@condition unconscious}.

reaction.name: Reposition
entries: When an enemy spots Mariya, she can use this reaction to immediately disengage and move her full movement speed.

legendaryHeader: Mariya has one villain action, used on the first round of combat. If she is incapacitated when her villain action would activate, she is skipped in the villain action order.

legendary.name: Dread Ambush
entries: Mariya makes 3 longbow attacks, the first at advantage, and the third at disadvantage. Afterwards, she turns {@condition invisible}.

monster.name: Heskan of Norixius, Zhentarim Inquisitor

action.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Heskan makes one Light Glaive attack on a target against whom he has advantage. The attack deals an extra {@damage 4d6} damage.

action.name: Insightful Multiattack
entries: Heskan makes two sweeping Light Glaive attacks, hitting up to two targets in his range by consuming an Uncanny Insight on each.

action.name: Fire Breath (3/day)
entries: Heskan exhales fire in a 30-foot by 5-foot line. Targets within the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw, taking {@damage 2d10} fire damage on a failed save or half on a successful save.

action.name: Light Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Uncanny Insight
entries: Heskan's abilities allow him to build up Uncanny Insight on his enemies. When making an attack or inducing a save on a target, he can choose to burn one Uncanny Insight on the target to give his attack advantage or their save disadvantage.

bonus.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: Heskan throws a smoke bomb at his feet, creating a 15 foot square {@spell fog cloud} effect for one turn.

bonus.name: Chromatic Warding (1/day)
entries: Channeling his draconic ancestry, Heskan becomes immune to fire damage for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Inquisition
entries: When an enemy of Heskan misses an attack or fails to induce a saving throw, Heskan observes them and gains one uncanny insight on them.

legendaryHeader: Heskan has one Villain Action which activates on the second round of combat. If he is incapacitated when it should activate, he is skipped in the Villain Action order.

legendary.name: Butterfly Effect
entries: Heskan throws a handful of red-hot sovereigns into the air, dealing 1 fire damage to every creature within 5 feet, as well as gaining Uncanny Insight on every enemy who can see this display. After, Heskan immediately moves up to his speed and makes a sneak attack.

monster.name: Nashwa, Daughter of Rakim, Zhentarim Guide

spellcasting.name: Psychic Storm
headerEntries: Nashwa is a trained Hadat. Her psionic DC is 14 and she has 6 Heat Capacity. Her loyalty is not strong enough to burn her brain, even if all of her allies die.

action.name: Hasty Escape
entries: Nashwa makes two quarterstaff attacks and then takes the disengage action as part of this action.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psionic Blast
entries: Nashwa targets a point within 60 feet. All creatures within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 14} Intelligence Saving Throw, taking {@damage 2d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half on a success.

bonus.name: Enhanced Emanations
entries: Nashwa invokes one of her bonus action emanations with a free tier of overclock.

reaction.name: Enhanced Reflection
entries: Nashwa invokes 「REFLECT」. The first time the emanation is invoked with this reaction, it does not build up heat.

legendaryHeader: Nashwa has one villain action which happens on the third round. If she is unconscious when this action would trigger, her position in the Villain Action order is skipped.

legendary.name: Suffocating Silence
entries: Nashwa lashes out with psychic power, psychically choking up to 3 enemies, silencing them and dealing {@damage 1d6} psychic damage every turn on a {@dc 14} Intelligence Saving Throw, SEOTE.

monster.name: Skamos, Zhentarim Berserker

action.name: Reckless Multiattack
entries: Skamos makes two greataxe attacks with advantage. Any attacks made against Skamos until the end of his next turn have advantage.

action.name: Primal Lance
entries: Skamos goes into a rage, throwing a javelin while he does so. As long as Skamos deals or takes damage every turn, he resists all damage except psychic, deals 2 more damage with every attack, and gains 10 feet of movement speed.

action.name: Greataxe +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Feral Spirit
entries: Skamos punches an ally for {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage, ending one effect on them causing the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

bonus.name: Pin Down
entries: Skamos charges down an enemy, forcing an Athletics (Strength) contest against their Athletics (Strength) or Acrobatics (Dexterity), and pushing them {@condition prone} on a success. If the target is already {@condition prone}, they are now {@condition grappled} as Skamos steps on their chest.

reaction.name: Law of Beasts
entries: When an enemy within 60 feet of Skamos attempts to leave the melee range of Skamos or one of his allies, he can howl, inducing a {@dc 14} Wisdom Save against {@condition frightened}, SEOTE.

legendaryHeader: Skamos has one villain action, which triggers in the fourth round of combat. If Skamos is incapacitated when this action would be triggered, his position in the Villain Action order is skipped.

legendary.name: Primal Hatred
entries: Skamos pounces onto the nearest enemy, knocking them {@condition prone} and making four greataxe attacks. After this, Skamos's rage automatically ends.

monster.name: Reeza of Many-Arrows, Zhentarim Mastermind

trait.name: Mastermind
entries: When Reeza rolls initiative, she gives a +2 to her allies but takes a -2 to her own initiative roll.

trait.name: Many-Arrows Heir
entries: When Reeza is reduced to 0 hit points while at more than 1 hit point, she stays conscious with 1 hit point. Additionally, when she or an ally she commands deals a critical strike, add one extra damage dice to the roll.

action.name: Viper's Multiattack
entries: Reeza makes two dagger attacks against a single target. If either hits, the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution Saving Throw or become {@condition poisoned}. If the target fails this save by 3 or more, the target is {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} this way.

action.name: Commander's Strike
entries: Reeza commands one of her allies to make a melee attack with advantage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) damage.

bonus.name: Twisted Orders
entries: Reeza snaps and orders one of her allies to move, giving them 15 feet of disengaged movement.

reaction.name: Compulsory Interception
entries: When one of Reeza's allies is hit by an attack, she can command a different allies also within the attack's range to take the damage instead.

legendaryHeader: Reeza has one Villain Action, which happens on the fifth round. If she is incapacitated when her villain action would activate, it is skipped.

legendary.name: Black Network Pride
entries: Reeza rallies all her allies, letting all of them move up to their movement speed and make two attacks at advantage.

legendary.name: Black Network Vengeance
entries: If Reeza is the only surviving member of her team, and she hasn't fled for some reason, she instead collects all of her fallen allies weapons with mage hands before moving up to her movement speed and making three attacks with each, with the third of each at disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Strongheart casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paladin makes two Holy Strike attacks.

action.name: Holy Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Protect Another
entries: When a creature the paladin can see attacks another creature that is within 5 feet of them, the paladin can use their reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Castigate the Unholy
entries: When a creature misses the paladin with an attack, the paladin can choose to deal {@damage 1d4} radiant damage to them.

bonus.name: Vow of Gold
entries: The paladin wreathes a creature in golden light. Until the end of the paladin's next turn, the target creature gains a +2 to armor class, while the paladin takes a -2 penalty to their own armor class.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes three Fist of Stone attacks, the third at disadvantage.

action.name: Fist of Stone
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) force damage.

action.name: Burial Rites Blaster
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) force damage. On a hit, the guardian may choose to pull the target 10 feet closer.

trait.name: Heart Stone
entries: This guardian is powered by a singular Heart Stone. Every heart stone held by an Eternal Guardian gives it a +1 bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws.

bonus.name: Ancient Engineering
entries: The guardian stretches out a hand, reaching out to all the heart stones within defeated eternal guardians within 30 feet and incorporating them into its chassis.

monster.name: LE-KOYETTE, TRUE LOVE'S LAST KISS FILLS HER MOUTH WITH POISON AND SHE SWALLOWS IT ALL

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deadlord casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Matron of the Seas
entries: Le-Koyette can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Le-Koyette fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack Surge
entries: The deadlord makes two Flood Strike attacks. While in Surging Form, Le-Koyette can substitute one attack for a use of Miracle of Love or Beckoning Whispers.

action.name: Flood Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Beckoning Whispers
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage. On a hit, a target must make a {@dc 17} Charisma Saving Throw or be {@condition charmed} by Le-Koyette. While {@condition charmed} this way, the target must use their full movement on each turn to approach Le-Koyette.

action.name: Miracle of Love (3/Day)
entries: Le-Koyette targets two creatures within 120 feet she can see. The pair must make a summed {@dc 34} Charisma Saving Throw or be {@condition charmed} by Le-Koyette. While {@condition charmed} this way, the targets' field of view closes in on one another, making them blind to every creature not directly between them. This save can be repeated at the end of each of their turns.

bonus.name: Ocean's Call
entries: Le-Koyette teleports to any 5 foot square of contiguous standing water within 120 feet.

bonus.name: Endless Horde
entries: Le-Koyette summons an additional 3 Charmed Sahuagin Centurions or 1 additional Merrow Sniper from the back ranks, and these minions move up to their movement speed. While in Surging Form, this increases to a 6 Sahuagin Phalanx or 2 Merrow Snipers.

More than mere waterway guardians, riverines are embodiments of particular rivers. These spirits of nature take shape to defend their waters and interact with those who travel along their currents. From the waist up, riverines have skin the color of the waters they protect but are otherwise humanlike in appearance. From the waist down, they can manifest either humanlike legs or churning gouts of water. A riverine's personality reflects the nature of the river it arises from—some are lethargic while others are wild and reckless.

entries.name: A Riverine's Lair
entries: Some riverines enjoy reverence akin to worship. Their likenesses are cast as statues and housed in temples, and worshipers act as agents between the river spirits and the people who revere them. These temples often become the home of the riverine itself, serving as its lair, though other nexuses of power along the river's path—such as its source or a significant waterfall—can also be used as lairs by a riverine.
A riverine encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 13 (10,000 XP).

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the riverine can take one of the following lair actions; the riverine can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Phantasmal Mist
entries: The riverine creates fog around a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of the riverine until the end of the target's next turn.

items.name: River's Fury
entries: The riverine conjures swampy ground that briefly covers the ground in a 20-foot square the riverine can see within 120 feet of itself. That area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until initiative count 20 on the next round. Any creature, other than the riverine, that enters the affected area or starts its turn there takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a riverine's lair flourishes under the magic of the riverine's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items.name: Clearwater Sight
entries: The waters of the river serve as a conduit for the riverine's consciousness. As an action, the riverine can cast the {@spell clairvoyance} spell, requiring no spell components, targeting any point along the river it's connected to.

items.name: River's Bounty
entries: Freshwater fauna and flora reproduce rapidly and thrive in the waters within 1 mile of the riverine's lair. Foraging in these waters yields twice the usual amount of food.

items.name: Spirit Guidance
entries: Tracks appear along the banks of the river within 6 miles of the riverine's lair. The tracks lead to potential shelters and safe passages across the river's waters, while also leading away from areas that the riverine prefers to remain undisturbed.
If the riverine dies, the flora and fauna return to normal levels, and its river dries out over the course of {@dice 1d10} days. All other effects cease immediately.

legendaryHeader: Le-Koyette has four villain actions used after the turns of hostile creatures. Each corresponds to a round, used in order.

legendary.name: Round 1: Legion of Thralls
entries: Each of Le-Koyette's enthralled minions can move their full speed without taking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Round 2: All-Devouring Storm
entries: The storm surrounding Le-Koyette's army intensifies. Low-lying areas flood and the mist becomes nearly opaque. Non-aquan creatures must make a {@dc 12} Perception Check at the start of each of their turns. On a failed check, they are blind to everything more than 30 feet away until the start of their next turn.
Additionally, Le-Koyette enters surging form, gaining an extra bonus action and 30 Temporary Hit Points.

legendary.name: Round 3: Decimating Chorus
entries: Every creature within 30 feet of Le-Koyette or one of her thralls must make a {@dc 16} Charisma Saving Throw to halve {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and avoid being {@condition charmed} by Le-Koyette. A creature that fails this save can repeat their save against the charm at the end of each turn.

legendary.name: Round 4: Storm of Ancient Blood
entries: Le-Koyette sprays her tainted blood into the sky. Every non-undead creature exposed to the rain must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw to half {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The plaguehulk ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement and 5 hit points to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Late-Stage Embrace
entries: When the plaguehulk is hit by slashing, piercing or lightning damage, it sloughs off plague boluses, and every creature within 5 feet must make a {@dc 15} Constitution Saving Throw against {@disease Talona's Embrace |TOMK} exposure and {@damage 3d4} poison damage. A creature that passes this save is immune to the disease for the rest of the round.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The plaguehulk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fist of Talona
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. On a hit, target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution Saving Throw against {@disease Talona's Embrace |TOMK} exposure and {@damage 3d4} poison damage. A creature that passes this save is immune to the disease for the rest of the round.

action.name: Bite of Talona
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. On a hit, target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw against {@disease Talona's Embrace |TOMK} exposure and {@damage 3d4} poison damage. A creature that passes this save is immune to the disease for the rest of the round.

variant.name: Observatory
entries: The Plaguehulk within The Royal Observatory has special contextual abilities, as follows below:

entries.name: Improvised Weapon (Pillar)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft. line, one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Targets are knocked {@condition prone} on a hit.

entries.name: Improvised Weapon (Pillars)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft. radius, one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Targets are knocked {@condition prone} on a hit. If the plaguehulk does this attack while another standing pillar is in the radius, it collapses the observation platform, reducing the plaguehulk to 1 hit point and 0 feet of movement. It will only make this mistake if the attack would hit 3 or more targets.

entries.name: Turn 1: Rage Beyond Life
entries: The plaguehulk roars and charges down a foe, attempting to grapple them. On a success, it makes two bite attacks against them, and they are {@condition grappled}. On a failure, it makes one bite attack against them and they are {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Turn 2: Armament of Rot
entries: The plaguehulk takes hold of one of the supports for The Ruby Lens, prying the column free and wielding it in one hand as a weapon. It immediately makes one Pillar attack.

entries.name: Turn 3: Ferocious Arms
entries: The plaguehulk pulls off another support pillar, dual wielding the two pillars as the observation platform above wobbles. It then moves up to its movement and makes one Pillars attack.

entries.name: Turn 4: Hubris
entries: The plaguehulk attempts to pull off a third support pillar, resulting in the observation platform collapsing and crushing it, reducing it to one hit point and 0 feet of movement.

trait.name: Viral Mind
entries: The plaguespitter's limited mind sees all creatures infected with {@disease Talona's Embrace | TOMK} as allies innately.

trait.name: Sticky Goop
entries: The plaguespitter is immune to forced movement effects, unless it chooses to cooperate.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace|TOMK}.

action.name: Sickening Mucus
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution Saving Throw or be afflicted with {@disease Talona's Embrace | TOMK}. A creature who succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effect until the end of the round.

action.name: Carrion Devourer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. When the plaguespitter hits a creature with this attack, it gains {@dice 2d4} Temporary Hit Points.

action.name: Virulent Webbing {@recharge 5}
entries: The plaguespitter fires a massive glob of sticky goop, creating a 10-foot radius puddle of sticky goop with the effects of the web spell with a DC of 13.

bonus.name: Sticky Shield
entries: The plaguespitter volleys a thick mucus-like resin onto an ally, giving it +1 AC until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Plagued Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the paladin fails a saving throw, it can call on its dark master to redirect its suffering to a nearby ally, instantly killing a minion, or dealing 5 damage to a non-minion ally.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace|TOMK}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paladin makes three attacks using Rotten Oathblade, Vile Expulsion, or both.

action.name: Rotten Oathblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, they can't regain hit points until the start of the paladin's next turn.

action.name: Vile Expulsion
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) poison damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution Saving Throw against {@disease Talona's Embrace | TOMK}. A creature that passes this save is immune to the disease for one turn.

bonus.name: Advance and Attack
entries: The paladin barks orders at one ally or two minions within 60 feet of who can hear it. The targeted ally(s) can use their reaction to move up to their speed and make an attack.

reaction.name: Eternal Legion
entries: When a non-minion creature the paladin can see within 120 feet of it takes damage, the paladin magically summons three Plague-Cursed Thralls who appear in a space the paladin can see within 120 feet.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 14} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace|TOMK}. A creature that succeeds this saving throw is immune to the disease until the end of it's next turn.

trait.name: Minion
entries: When this creature takes damage from an attack or failed save, it dies. If it takes damage from any other source, it is reduced to 0 hit points if the damage it takes is higher than its max hit points.

action.name: Clawing Horde (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} + X to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 * X bludgeoning damage and an additional {@h}2 * X poison damage, and if this attack was made by three or more thralls, the target must make a {@dc 10} + X Constitution Saving Throw against {@disease Talona's Embrace | TOMK}.

monster.name: SI'QILEK'TER, WITCH OF TYRANNY

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

spellcasting.name: Aberrant Psionics
headerEntries: The witch harnesses psionic energy from the Far Realms to do battle. She has a limitless heat capacity, but she is only able to overclock emanations by one tier. Her psionics DC is 17.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the witch fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Surpass (1/Day)
entries: When a creature would succeed on a saving throw against one of her psionic emanations, the witch can instead bypass the save entirely and proceed as if the creature failed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witch makes two Infernal Chains attacks and can use Miasma of Tranquility or any 1 action spell or emanation below her maximum tier.

action.name: Infernal Chains
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, the vine wraps around the target, and the target has the {@condition grappled} condition (escape {@dc 17}). The vine vanishes when the target is no longer {@condition grappled}, or when the witch wills it to (no action required).

action.name: Miasma of Tranquility {@recharge 5}
entries: The witch exhales soporific vapor in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition poisoned} condition. A {@condition poisoned} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failed save, it has the {@condition unconscious} condition, and on a successful save, the effect ends on it. An {@condition unconscious} creature is no longer {@condition poisoned} and remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, until it takes damage, or until a creature uses an action to shake it awake.

The Gardener is an archfey who adores the splendor of nature, the joy of song, and the glow of shared merriment. This ancient being once wandered the Feywild and worlds of the Material Plane until two dear friends created a wondrous garden and asked the Gardener to tend to it. The Gardener agreed to the request, then pulled the garden from the Material Plane and transformed it into a Domain of Delight—a region of the Feywild that bows to an archfey's will. This place became known as the Eternal Garden.
The Gardener abhors bloodshed and avoids killing even those who threaten the garden, preferring to entangle them in vines and pacify them with tranquilizing breaths of flowery mist.

entries.name: The Gardener's Lair
entries: The Gardener's lair is the entirety of the Eternal Garden.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Gardener can take one of the following lair actions; they can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Plant Walk
items.entry: The Gardener moves up to their speed into the space of a Medium or larger plant within the lair, then teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of any other Medium or larger plant within the lair.

items.name: Vine Wall
items.entry: A wall of grasping vines appears on the ground within 120 feet of the Gardener. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, and it blocks line of sight. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or have the grappled condition (escape DC 15). A creature must make this saving throw when it starts its turn inside the wall or when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn. The wall's area is difficult terrain for a creature that isn't grappled. The wall sinks back into the ground, freeing all creatures grappled by it, when the Gardener uses this lair action again or when the Gardener dies.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The Eternal Garden has the following features:

items.name: Boundary
items.entry: At the border of the domain is a lightly obscuring mist, tinged with a sweet blossom scent and the colors of sunset. No matter how far a creature travels into the mist, the creature finds itself back where it entered the border, returning to the garden.

items.name: Eternal Summer
items.entry: The climate in the garden is a perpetual, lovely summer, but weather conditions reflect the emotional tone of creatures in the garden. In times of danger, thunderstorms shake the sky. During times of melancholy or mourning, chill rain patters throughout the domain.

items.name: Gardener's Vigil
items.entry: The Gardener senses when anything dies in the garden. If a creature dies in the garden, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the Gardener appears on initiative count 20 of the next round (losing initiative ties) to investigate.

items.name: Lighting
items.entry: The sky above the garden is a perpetual twilight range of orange, red, pink, and yellow hues with no visible sun, moon, or stars. During daylight hours, it emits bright light, but at night, it never reaches full darkness, becoming dim light instead.

items.name: Memory Loss
items.entry: Unless otherwise stated, a creature that leaves the domain must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw; Fey creatures and creatures with the Fey Ancestry trait automatically succeed on the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing of its time in the garden or the Palace of Spires. On a successful save, the creature's memories remain intact, but they're hazy and dreamlike. A Remove Curse or Greater Restoration spell restores the creature's memories.

items.name: Time
items.entry: Time passes slower in the Eternal Garden relative to other planes. For each day spent in the garden, one year passes on the Material Plane.

legendaryHeader: The witch has three Villain Actions, each used after an enemy completes their turn.

legendary.name: Round 1: Melding Flesh
entries: The witch targets up to 4 hostile creatures, linking them together with a {@spell 「fusion」|TOMK} emanation unless they succeed on an Intelligence Saving Throw. Then, to show off, she launches an order one {@spell 「lance」|TOMK} into the linked group. If a low intelligence target passes the save on luck, she will consider using surpass.

legendary.name: Round 2: Visage of the Far Realms
entries: The witch screeches, momentarily releasing her true form in a burst of corrupting light and noise. Non-aberrations who can see the witch must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom Saving Throw or become {@condition frightened} of her, resaving at the end of every turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is afflicted with Short Term Madness until they save against fright.

legendary.name: Round 3: Chains of the Godeater
entries: A portal appears below the witch, and Godeater Tendrils pour out, impaling her, puppeting her body, and sending her electrified chains. The witch make up to six Infernal Chains attacks against targets within 30 feet, targets {@condition grappled} by these attacks are immediately pulled to be adjacent to the witch. The witch takes {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage as her master drains her life.

legendary.name: Round 4 Onward: Witchblood Wrath
entries: The witch's dark master floods her body with necrotic energy, spraying her vile blood on nearby creatures. Every non-aberration within 20 feet must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity Saving Throw to half {@damage 6d6 + 5} necrotic damage and a stack of {@condition marked for death|TOMK}.

reactionHeader: The witch has 3 reactions each round, but she can use no more than 1 per round.

action.name: Burning Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 2d10} fire damage.

trait.name: Fiery Body
entries: Any creature that touches this construct with a melee attack takes 5 fire damage.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: The construct can make an attack of opportunity against any creature who enters its melee range using its reaction. A creature hit by the construct's attacks of opportunity becomes 0 for the rest of their turn.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The returned hydra doesn't need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The returned hydra has only two heads remaining. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

The hydra is a reptilian horror with a crocodilian body and multiple heads on long, serpentine necks. Although its heads can be severed, the hydra magically regrows them in short order. A typical specimen has five heads. At the dawn of time, Tiamat, the Queen of Evil Dragons, slew a rival dragon god named Lernaea and cast her blood across the multiverse. Each drop that fell upon a world spawned a multi-headed hydra consumed by a hunger as great as the fallen god's hatred. Great champions are known to test their mettle against these fearsome creatures.

entries.name: Everlasting Hunger
entries: A rapacious and gluttonous monster, a hydra snatches and tears apart its prey in a frenzy of feeding. When a hydra has cleared a territory of food and driven off any creatures smart enough to avoid it, it moves on to seek its meals elsewhere. A hydra's hunger is so great that if it can't feed, it might turn against itself, its heads attacking each other as the creature eats itself alive.

entries.name: Hardy Water Dwellers
entries: Hydras are natural swimmers, dwelling in rivers, along lakeshores, in ocean shallows, and in wetland bogs. A hydra rarely requires shelter from the elements, so it doesn't normally have a lair. Only in colder climes are hydras drawn to the protection of sheltered caverns and ruins. When a hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads remains awake and alert, making the creature difficult to catch by surprise.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage. On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 15} Strength Saving Throw or {@condition grappled} in the dragon's mouth.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Vain and territorial, blue dragons soar through the skies over deserts, preying on caravans and plundering herds and settlements in the verdant lands beyond the desert's reach. These dragons can also be found in dry steppes, searing badlands, and rocky coasts. They guard their territories against all potential competitors, especially brass dragons.

A blue dragon is recognized by its dramatic frilled ears and the massive ridged horn atop its blunt head. Rows of spikes extend back from its nostrils to line its brow, and cluster on its jutting lower jaw.

A blue dragon's scales vary in color from an iridescent azure to a deep indigo, polished to a glossy finish by the desert sands. As the dragon ages, its scales become thicker and harder, and its hide hums and crackles with static electricity. These effects intensify when the dragon is angry or about to attack, giving off an odor of ozone and dusty air.

entries.name: Vain and Deadly
entries: A blue dragon will not stand for any remark or insinuation that it is weak or inferior, taking great pleasure in lording its power over humanoids and other lesser creatures.

A blue dragon is a patient and methodical combatant. When fighting on its own terms, it turns combat into an extended affair of hours or even days, attacking from a distance with volleys of lightning, then flying well out of harm's reach as it waits to attack again.

entries.name: Desert Predators
entries: Though they sometimes eat cacti and other desert plants to sate their great hunger, blue dragons are carnivores. They prefer to dine on herd animals, cooking those creatures with their lightning breath before gorging themselves. Their dining habits make blue dragons an enormous threat to desert caravans and nomadic tribes, which become convenient collections of food and treasure to a dragon's eye.

When it hunts, a blue dragon buries itself in the desert sand so that only the horn on its nose pokes above the surface, appearing to be an outcropping of stone. When prey draws near, the dragon rises up, sand pouring from its wings like an avalanche as it attacks.

entries.name: Overlords and Minions
entries: Blue dragons covet valuable and talented creatures whose service reinforces their sense of superiority. Bards, sages, artists, wizards, and assassins can become valuable agents for a blue dragon, which rewards loyal service handsomely.

A blue dragon keeps its lair secret and well protected, and even its most trusted servants are rarely allowed within. It encourages ankhegs, giant scorpions, and other creatures of the desert to dwell near its lair for additional security. Older blue dragons sometimes attract air elementals and other creatures to serve them.

entries.name: Hoarders of Gems
entries: Though blue dragons collect anything that looks valuable, they are especially fond of gems. Considering blue to be the most noble and beautiful of colors, they covet sapphires, favoring jewelery and magic items adorned with those gems.
A blue dragon buries its most valuable treasures deep in the sand, while scattering a few less valuable trinkets in plainer sight over hidden sinkholes to punish and eliminate would-be thieves.

entries.name: A Blue Dragon's Lair
entries: Blue dragons make their lairs in barren places, using their lightning breath and their burrowing ability to carve out crystallized caverns and tunnels beneath the sands.

Thunderstorms rage around a legendary blue dragon's lair, and narrow tubes lined with glassy sand ventilate the lair, all the while avoiding the deadly sinkholes that are the dragon's first line of defense.

A blue dragon will collapse the caverns that make up its lair if that lair is invaded. The dragon then burrows out, leaving its attackers to be crushed and suffocated. When it returns later, it collects its possessions-along with the wealth of the dead intruders.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

entries.name: Dragons
entries: True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.

reaction.name: Hard Landing
entries: When a creature passes under the undead dragon, it can stop flapping its wings, plummeting down onto the character below it. The creature below must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every five feet the dragon falls. On a successful save, the dragon takes half of this damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merrow can breathe air and water.

action.name: Rain of Arrows (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk rw}{@hit 5}+X to hit, range 120/240 feet, one target. {@h} X piercing and 2X lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Trap (Group Action)
entries: Target an empty square within 120 feet and fire an electrified, {@condition invisible} wire trap onto it. Once stepped on, every creature within 10 feet must make a {@dc 10}+X Dexterity Saving Throw or take 3X lightning damage and be {@condition slowed|TOMK}.

Merrow haunt coastal waters, preying on fisherfolk, merfolk, and any other edible creature that crosses their path. These savage monsters snatch and devour unwary prey, hauling drowned corpses back to their underwater grottoes to feed.

entries.name: Transformed Merfolk
entries: Long ago, a tribe of merfolk found an idol of Demogorgon at the bottom of the sea.

Not knowing what it was, they brought the artifact to their king. Everyone who touched the idol became afflicted with madness, including the king, who decreed that a sacrificial ritual be performed to open a gateway to the Abyss. The ocean turned red with the blood of slaughtered merfolk, but the ritual worked, and the king led the survivors through the underwater gate to Demogorgon's layer of the Abyss. The merfolk remained there for generations, fighting for their lives as the Abyss warped them completely, transforming them into hulking, evil monstrosities. Thus, the first merrow were born.

entries.name: Coastal Bullies
entries: Whenever an opportunity presents itself, the Prince of Demons sends merrow back to the Material Plane to wreak havoc in the oceans. The merrow are bullies, attacking all creatures smaller and weaker than themselves.

Merrow dwell in undersea caves filled with treasures and trophies, taken from their victims and sunken ships. They tie the rotting corpses of dead enemies and drowned sailors to strands of kelp to mark the borders of their territory.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Magma Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon pools roiling magma in its mouth then expels it in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage and 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage, and they are {@condition restrained} by igneous rock. On a successful save, the creature takes half a much damage.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus.name: Psychic Step
entries: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The dragon makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Explosive Crystal (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dragon spits an amethyst that that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

action.name: Signature Attack (< Swordname >)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 plus PB} piercing damage. Beginning at 7th level, Eiglay can make this attack twice, instead of once, when she takes the Attack action on her turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Binding Discipline (3/Day)
entries: When using her signature attack, Eiglay can use a bonus action to infuse her attack with the rigidity of law. The target of this smite must make a {@dc 10} plus PB wisdom saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn as golden chains envelop it. On a save failed by 5 or more, the creature is also silenced.

action.name: 5th Level: Brutal Charge (3/Day)
entries: Eiglay charges at least 10 feet then attempts to topple a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} plus PB Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Succeed or fail, Eiglay then makes two signature attacks against any creature within reach.

action.name: 7th Level: Shield of the Righteous (1/Day)
entries: When an ally within 30 feet of Eiglay is hit by an attack within 2 of their AC, Eiglay can activate her Golden Vow to give that ally a +2 bonus to AC until a long rest, at the cost of a -2 penalty to her own AC.

bonus.name: Awakened: 「SHADE」
entries: If awakened, Eiglay has a max Heat Capacity of 2, which she can use to invoke {@spell 「SHADE」| TOMK} with a psionics DC of 9 plus PB.

optionalfeature.name: Hit and Run
entries: After making this attack, move up to 10 feet to a location not within the target's melee range.

optionalfeature.name: Warning Shot
entries: After making this attack, select a 5ft by 5ft square within your range and sight. If a creature enters that square before the start of your next turn, you can use your reaction to make an Attack of Opportunity against them.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Volley
entries: Using this attack, make two attacks on different creatures. Do not add your ability modifier to the damage for these attacks, and take a -4 penalty to your roll to hit.

optionalfeature.name: Skirmisher's Shot
entries: Before making this attack, you may move up to your movement for free.

optionalfeature.name: Archer's Stairway
entries: Target a vertical surface no more than 25 feet high and fire a storm of arrows, creating a staircase which allows any creature to climb the surface as if they had a climbing speed.

optionalfeature.name: Sustaining Strike
entries: If this attack is lethal, take a +2 bonus to your next attack and do not expend this power.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Trap
entries: If this shot lands, it reduces the target's move speed to 10 feet. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a saving throw against your Strength or Dexterity DC, whichever stat you used for this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Hunt's Climax
entries: If the target of this attack is bloodied and the focus of your hunter's mark, the attack deals 2 extra dice of damage and gains a Critical Width bonus of +1. If the attack hits, your hunter's mark ends.

optionalfeature.name: Begin the Hunt
entries: When rolling initiative, add +2 to your initiative roll, and immediately activate your hunter's mark. While your hunter's mark is on this target, take a +2 bonus to hits against it.

optionalfeature.name: Rattle the Senses
entries: If this attack hits, the target loses one bonus action, one reaction, and any special senses. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a Constitution Saving Throw against your Strength or Dexterity DC (whichever you used for this attack), ending the effect on a success. On a missed attack, the target spends one reaction if possible.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Tail
entries: The target of this attack must make a Strength saving throw against your Ki DC or fall prone. Additionally, activating this power puts you in Dragon Stance.

entries.name: Dragon Stance
entries: While in Dragon Stance, you can consume 10 feet of movement speed in order to swap positions with an ally or prone enemy within 40 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Lion's Den
entries: You may choose to push the target of this attack 5 feet. Until the start of your next turn, when a creature comes within 5 feet of you, you may choose to deal bludgeoning damage to it equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, activating this power puts you into Lion Stance.

entries.name: Lion Stance
entries: While in Lion Stance, you can choose to trade your full movement speed for a +1 bonus to AC and all saving throws and a 5 feet of disengaged movement.

optionalfeature.name: Slumbering Hurt
entries: If the target of this attack is bloodied, all attacks you make against it this turn deal extra damage equal to your strength modifier. Additionally, bloodied enemies cannot make reaction attacks against you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gentle Rainfall
entries: This unarmed attack targets every creature within 5 feet, and you gain 5 feet of movement per hit. If at least one attack hits, you additionally disengage.

optionalfeature.name: Granite Avalanche
entries: You rain rocks down on a 10 foot by 10 foot square, and all creatures inside must make a Dexterity Saving through against your Ki DC to half 2d8 bludgeoning damage. Creatures who fail this save additionally take an ongoing -2 penalty to attacks, with a chance to save at the end of each of their turns. Afterwards, you may warp to any point within 5 feet of an affected space.

optionalfeature.name: Harmonious Thunder
entries: Using this attack, make two unarmed attacks on different targets. Creatures hit by these attacks are wrapping in roiling thunder, taking additional damage equal to your Strength modifier when damaged by attacks. Any time a creature takes damage this way, they can make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Ki DC to end the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Harmonious Discipline
entries: Gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Wisdom modifier. When you lose your last temporary hitpoint, you gain a bonus to your next attack roll equal to your Wisdom modifier. If unused, this buff disappears after 10 minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Instrument of Earth
entries: Target a creature within 15 feet to make a Strength Saving Throw against your Ki DC. On a failed save, they are pulled into your unarmed attack range and take 2d6 bludgeoning damage (half on save). Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Eye in the Sky
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you gain a +5 bonus to perception checks. When an enemy comes within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet disengaged into a square adjacent to them and gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws against them.

optionalfeature.name: Salamander's Charge
entries: Move up to your movespeed, leaving a trail of fire, then make an unarmed attack that deals 2d6 fire damage. When a creature enters the fire trail or starts their turn inside it, they take fire damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Static Shock
entries: The target of this attack takes 2 lightning damage. On a hit, it takes a penalty equal to your Intelligence modifier on its next attack.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Chill
entries: Target a creature within 20 feet. All enemies within 5 feet of that creature must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. They take cold damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, plus an additonal 1d8 on a failed save. Additionally, they take cold damage equal to your Intelligence modifier the next time they attack the primary target.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Emitter
entries: You drop a magical shielding device. Every creature within 5 feet of the device gains 1/2 cover (+2 AC) to attacks from outside this range.

optionalfeature.name: Halo of Thorns
entries: You coat your weapon in a special poison, adding poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier to this attack. Then, you can pass this poison to an ally within 25 feet, coating one weapon or piece of ammunition with a single attack's dose.

optionalfeature.name: Flameburst Armor
entries: You carve burning runes into a creature's armor or clothing. For the next hour, the targeted creature has resistance to fire damage and can use their action to deal 5 fire damage to all creatures within 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Life-Tapping Darts
entries: You strike a target with life-extracting needles. Make an Intelligence attack against the target. On a hit, you deal 2d10 + Intelligence necrotic damage. Then, you can give the stolen life essence to an ally within 30 feet, giving them 10 Temporary Hit Points (half on a miss).

optionalfeature.name: Swift Mender
entries: You send a miniature drone out to assist an ally within 120 feet. The targeted ally can immediately attempt to save against one ongoing effect currently affecting them with a +1 bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Henchman
entries: When an attack would hit you, you can drop a phantasmal projector, increasing your AC by 2 and potentially turning the attack into a miss. On your turn, the illusion created by the projector can move up to your movement and make an attack using your intelligence which deals 2d6 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Springboard
entries: You summon a 5 foot by 5 foot magical trampoline in a space you can touch. Any creature you permit can walk onto its space and jump up or forward a distance equal to five times your Intelligence modifier in feet.

optionalfeature.name: Flameheart Defender
entries: You construct a small guardian construct (Flameheart Defender) in a square adjacent to you. It persists for one hour.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte Strike
entries: If the target of this attack attempts an attack against you before the start of your next turn, you may make an attack of opportunity against it.

optionalfeature.name: Preparatory Strike
entries: When making a ranged attack with this power, gain advantage on attacks against the target of this attack until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: King's Castle
entries: Make a melee attack which pushes the target back 5 feet on a hit, then swap positions with an ally within 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: One-Two Punch
entries: Make two melee attacks against different creatures. If both hit, you can divide your sneak attack dice freely between the two targets.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Barrage
entries: Make a thrown weapon or ranged attack. The target and every creature within 10 feet take damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. All affected creatures must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Finesse DC or be blinded until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Confounding Attack
